As an AI language model, I don't have specific data on Nazareth, but in general, businesses and industries in areas with changing consumer demographics typically adapt in the following ways:

1. Offering language-specific services: As populations become more diverse, businesses may offer language-specific services to better cater to their customers. This can include bilingual staff, signage, and marketing materials.

2. Expanding cultural offerings: Restaurants, shops, and entertainment venues may expand their offerings to include options that cater to new cultural groups in the area.

3. Adjusting marketing strategies: Businesses may adjust their marketing strategies to better target new demographics. This can include advertising in different languages or targeting specific cultural events and holidays.

4. Updating product lines: As tastes and preferences change, businesses may update their product lines to better appeal to changing demographics.

5. Embracing diversity and inclusion: Overall, businesses and industries may need to embrace diversity and inclusivity in order to thrive in a changing population. This can include hiring a diverse staff and ensuring that all customers feel welcome and valued.
